name: Cornerstone Community Outreach
description: Homeless shelter that offers food bags, free store for clothes, and dinner guest program.

name: Night Ministry Healthcare Bus
description: Traveling outreach bus equipped with nurse’s office brings healthcare to underserved communities and provides food, survival supplies, and case management/referral services; refer to site for locations and schedule.

name: Greater Chicago Food Depository
address: 4100 W Ann Lurie Pl, Chicago, IL 60632
description: Use website to find groceries/hot meals. Cook County's food bank, connect to food pantries, soup kitches, & shelters.

name: Rincon Family Services Living Room
description: Services also offered in Spanish. The Living Room Program (LRP) is for individuals in need of crisis respite program with services and supports designed to proactively divert crises and break the cycle of psychiatric hospitalization. The LRP provides a safe, inviting, home-like atmosphere where individuals can calmly process the crisis event, as well as learn and apply wellness strategies which may prevent future crisis events. Along with the main living room space, they also offer private space, a meditation room, an art therapy room, gaming room, a library, a kitchenette with snacks and beverages, showers, and a washing machine/dryer.

name: Above and Beyond Family Treatment Center
description: Individualized recovery w/ support programs (12 Step, SMART, REBT, Art Therapy, Mindful Meditation) and success-based services (case management, housing by referral, employment).

name: Westside Health Authority’s (WHA) Community Employment Center
description: Westside Health Authority’s (WHA) Community Employment Center specializes in helping Chicago residents find pathways to employment and long-term career success, while servicing the human resources needs of local businesses. You will need your ID & Social Security card to register. If you don’t have ID’s, please contact our case manager for assistance.

name: Chicago Community Loan Fund
address: 29 E Madison St, Suite 1700, Chicago, IL 60602
description: Provides flexible loans for housing, commercial/economic development, social enterprises, and community facility space

name: Broadway Youth Center (Howard Brown)
address: 1023 W Irving Park Rd, Chicago, IL 60613
description: Walk-in center providing youth 12-24 w/ primary care services including hormones, STD/I screening, birth control, PrEP, vaccines, psychiatry, etc. Also provides assistance singing up for health insurance, education assistance, and mental wellness support.

name: Austin Community Family Center
description: Serves youth, families, adults, and seniors w/ activities & fitness, programs, and events

name: Traffick
description: Call/email for address. For adult female-identifying sex workers/trafficking victims

name: Between Friends Chicago
description: Programs to connect survivors and prevent/reduce SA. Their number is also a 24/7 hotline.

name: Englewood Community Service Center
description: Community Service Centers help individuals and families in need access a wide range of resources from shelter, food and clothing to domestic violence assistance, job training/placement and services for the formerly incarcerated. Clients can also get information about rental, utility and other financial assistance programs. The centers also serve as warming and cooling centers during periods of extreme weather.

name: Thresholds Living Room
description: The Living Room Program (LRP) is for individuals in need of crisis respite program with services and supports designed to proactively divert crises and break the cycle of psychiatric hospitalization. The LRP provides a safe, inviting, home-like atmosphere where individuals can calmly process the crisis event, as well as learn and apply wellness strategies which may prevent future crisis events. Along with Living Room services, it is housed in a building that also features many other on-site services that may be utilized by Thresholds clients, including a primary care clinic and pharmacy.

name: HAS (Healthcare Alternative Systems) Living Room - Belmont-Cragin
description: Services also offered in Spanish. The Living Room Program (LRP) is for individuals in need of crisis respite program with services and supports designed to proactively divert crises and break the cycle of psychiatric hospitalization. The LRP provides a safe, inviting, home-like atmosphere where individuals can calmly process the crisis event, as well as learn and apply wellness strategies which may prevent future crisis events.

name: Welcoming Center (Lutheran Social Services)
address: 5215 N California Ave, Suite F101, Chicago, IL 60625
description: The Welcoming Center is a mental health clinic for adults (18+) that offers counseling, case management, and psychiatric appointments. The Center is staffed with a team of nurses, social workers/counselors, peer specialists, and advanced practice nurses. Services include telehealth, immediate assessment and treatment, crisis services, fast-track to psychiatry services, counseling, case management, and support groups and peer counseling. These services are covered by Medicaid, Medicare, managed care, and private insurance.

name: Roseland Community Triage Center (HRDI)
description: Offers mental health crisis assessment, referrals, and counseling.

name: West Cook Homeownership Center
description: Homeownership counseling, foreclosure prevention, financial empowement, homeownership preservation, & down payment assistance

name: Inspiration Kitchens Job Training
description: Free 8-week job training program in food industry with paid training opportunities; fill out contact form on website to apply

name: Manufacturing Renaissance
description: See website for info; Career Pathway (job training, placements and support) for youth/young adults in the manufactuing industry

name: Jane Addams Resource Corporation
description: See website for info; Job training programs in CNC, welding & more.

name: Beyond Hunger
description: Needs photo ID & proof of address in service area (see website) every visit. Food distribution w/ help to apply for bublic benefits. Also offers cooking classes

name: The Pilsen Social Health Initiative
address: 1850 S Throop St, 2nd Floor, Chicago, IL 60608
description: Anti-poverty services that include: thrift store with discount and free programs, food pantry, pro bono physical therapy services and medical supplies, children's library, etc.

name: Garfield Community Service Center
description: Community Service Centers help individuals and families in need access a wide range of resources from shelter, food and clothing to domestic violence assistance, job training/placement and services for the formerly incarcerated. Clients can also get information about rental, utility and other financial assistance programs. The centers also serve as warming and cooling centers during periods of extreme weather.

name: Dr. Martin Luther King Community Service Center
address: 4314 S Cottage Grove Ave, Chicago, IL 60653
description: Community Service Centers help individuals and families in need access a wide range of resources from shelter, food and clothing to domestic violence assistance, job training/placement and services for the formerly incarcerated. Clients can also get information about rental, utility and other financial assistance programs. The centers also serve as warming and cooling centers during periods of extreme weather.

name: North Area Community Service Center
address: 845 W Wilson Ave, 2nd Floor, Chicago, IL 60640
description: Community Service Centers help individuals and families in need access a wide range of resources from shelter, food and clothing to domestic violence assistance, job training/placement and services for the formerly incarcerated. Clients can also get information about rental, utility and other financial assistance programs. The centers also serve as warming and cooling centers during periods of extreme weather.

description: Community Service Centers help individuals and families in need access a wide range of resources from shelter, food and clothing to domestic violence assistance, job training/placement and services for the formerly incarcerated. Clients can also get information about rental, utility and other financial assistance programs. The centers also serve as warming and cooling centers during periods of extreme weather.

name: Trina Davila Community Service Center
description: Community Service Centers help individuals and families in need access a wide range of resources from shelter, food and clothing to domestic violence assistance, job training/placement and services for the formerly incarcerated. Clients can also get information about rental, utility and other financial assistance programs. The centers also serve as warming and cooling centers during periods of extreme weather.

name: A House in Austin
description: For parenting support w/ groups & weekly chat hour, parent/child music classes, home visiting program, wellness practices, educational tools.

name: Westside Health Authority Youth Development Center
description: Youth Development Programs for participants ages 14 through 24. Include mentoring & youth advocacy, workforce development, and enrichment.

name: Westside Health Authority
description: Several Locations; check website for more info. Offers youth development, community reentry, employment services, and support services.

name: The Peace Corner Youth Center
description: Office hours are M-F 10-2pm during COVID. Serves youth w/ after school programs, summer (employment) programs, & volunteering opportunities.

name: Austin Coming Together
description: Connects Austin residents w/ a whole bunch of resources, see website

name: Triple S – Southside Safe Space (Howard Brown)
description: Drop in space for trans/GNC people 12-29 to provide community, hot meal pick-up, gorcery gift cards, basic hygene kits, & resource advocacy

name: Brave Space Alliance
description: *COVID hours; serves LGBTQ w/ food pantry (delivery), makeup room, & hot meals, check website for hours on these drop-in programs, also have online programming/services

name: Center On Halsted
description: Many programs centered on LGBTQ community, from cooking classes, yoga & volleyball games to job placement, HIV testing, and group therapy.

name: St. Joseph Services
description: Several location in Austin, Avondale, Genview, & Humboldt, check website for more info. Offers youth programs, citizenship classes, computer literacy, English as Second Language classes, open gym, Spanish classes, volunteer opportunities.

name: Build Chicago
description: Locations @ Austin & Humboldt; check website for more info. Serves youth w/ gang intervention, violence prevention, education, enrichment, mental health & wellness, & community engagement in Chicago's West Side

name: Erikson Institute
description: Services for children and families, includes mental health sevices for families w/ childen up to 8 and services for families stuggling w/ a fussy baby. Also offers graduate & continuing education.

name: Saint Leonard’s Ministry
description: Comprehensive residential, case management, and employment services for those released from prison without resources needed to rebuild their lives; volunteer opportunities.

name: Ricon Family Services
phone: Check website for number to appropriate service.
description: Multiple Locations; Services include mental health, family, prevention mandated court, and in-home care.

name: Thresholds
description: Many service/programs, check website. They include: Substance Use Treatment, Intensive Outreach for Mental Health, Youth & Young Adult Services, Integrated Primary & Behavioral Healthcare, Justice Program, Deaf Program, Peer Services, Housing and Homelessness, Transitioning from Institutional Care, Veterans Project, IPS Employment Services, and Creative Arts Therapy

name: HAS (Healthcare Alternative Systems)
description: Services are also offered in Spanish. Locations in Brighton Park, West Loop, Logan Square, Bucktown, and Belmont-Cragin. Many services avaliable, check website. They include: Anger Management, Assessment and Referral, Domestic Violence Program, Community Support Team (CST), Continuing Care, DUI Evaluation and Education, Medication Assisted Treatment, Mental Health Services, Outpatient/Intensive Outpatient Treatment, Partner Abuse Prevention Program (PAIP), Postpartum Depression, Probation/Parole Services, Recovery Support Services – Madden, Residential Treatment, The Living Room, Transitional Housing, and Youth Substance Abuse Treatment and Prevention

name: HRDI
description: Multiple locations in the South side, check website. Services include: Intake and Assessment, Substance Use Screening, Child & Adolescent, Outpatient Counseling and Therapy, School Based Interventions, Crisis Assessments (Jackson Park Hospital; St. Bernard Hospital; Roseland Triage Center), Residential Treatment & Group Living, Opioid Treatment (Medication Assisted Treatment), Team Based Services, Case Management, Care Transitions, Parenting Assessment, Health Risk Screening/Assessment, Treatment Planning, Housing Support, and Financial Benefit Support

name: Howard Brown Health
description: Multiple locations around Chicago. Offers healthcare for LGBT+ people, incuding access to hormones,  various other health services, STI/STD treatment, counseling, and more.

name: Trilogy Behavioral Healthcare
description: Multiple locations, check website. Many services centered on mental health.

name: El Rincon Community Clinic (Ricon Family Services)
description: Rincon offers bilingual, culturally relevant services to individuals enrolled in opioid maintenance treatment that include methadone, medical monitoring by staff physicians, Individual and group counseling, and toxicology testing.

name: Chicago Lights
description: Chicago Lights offers Services at the Fourth Presbyterian Churc. They have a food pantry and a cloting shop, though they are appointment only due to COVID. They also have curbside drop-in resources that include clothing, toiletries (soap, toothpaste, lotion, incontinence products, menstruation products), housing and shelter information, public benefits information, referrals to other agencies, access to a guest phone, and information about neighborhood food pantries and meal services. Chicago Lights also offers youth programs, including tutoring, summer learning and enrichment, an urban farm, and a dance academy.
